Package generation

Class Wallboard

java.lang.Object
generation.Wallboard
public class Wallboard extends Object
Basic class to describe a wallboard which is located at a cell (x,y) and at that cell it is located in a particular direction. One can compute the location of a neighboring cell, however that location is only valid for an internal wallboard, i.e. if the neighboring cell is inside the maze. It is used to hold wallboard coordinates for Prim's Maze Generation and for the logging mechanism.

  • Constructor Details

    • Wallboard

      public Wallboard​(int x, int y, CardinalDirection cd)
      Constructor, values have same effect has setWall(x,y,cd).
      Parameters:
      x - is the x coordinate, 0 <= x < width
      y - is the y coordinate, 0 <= y < height
      cd - is the direction of wallboard in the cell

  • Method Details

    • setLocationDirection

      public void setLocationDirection​(int x, int y, CardinalDirection cd)
      Sets the internal fields to the given values for a (x,y) position and direction
      Parameters:
      x - is the x coordinate, 0 <= x < width
      y - is the y coordinate, 0 <= y < height
      cd - is the direction

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Get the x coordinate for the current (x,y) position.
      Returns:
      the x coordinate

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Get the y coordinate for the current (x,y) position.
      Returns:
      the y coordinate

    • setRandomly

      public void setRandomly​(int width, int height)
      Pick a random position (x,y) and a random direction within the given limits and assign these values to this wallboard.
      Parameters:
      width - such that 0 <= x < width
      height - such that 0 <= y < height

    • getNeighborX

      public int getNeighborX()
      Computes the x coordinate of neighboring (adjacent) cell for internal walls. If the wallboard is a border wallboard to the outside, then the resulting value is out of range as the cell does not exist.
      Returns:
      the x coordinate of adjacent cell

    • getNeighborY

      public int getNeighborY()
      Computes the y coordinate of neighboring (adjacent) cell for internal walls. If the wallboard is a border wallboard to the outside, then the resulting value is out of range as the cell does not exist.
      Returns:
      the y coordinate of adjacent cell

    • getDirection

      public CardinalDirection getDirection()
      Provides the direction for the wallboard with regard to the internal position (x,y).
      Returns:
      the direction of this wallboard with regard to its cell location
